page.title: 05Tourism in Herm, page 1.
page.content: Herm is visited by over 100,000 tourists each year. They are looking for the "dream island" of which the present tenant of Herm said; "If I was asked to design an island and place it anywhere in the world I chose, this is the island I would design, and this is where I would put it." Herm has some of the best beaches in the Channel Islands, the most famous being Shell beach in the north-east, where over 200 different varities of shells have been found. It also has pretty scenery, fine cliff walks and a large grassy common where many rabbits live. Other attractions are fishing and walking, and for naturalists, birds, flowers and insects abound. Herm's 500 acres extend to 1,500 at low tide.
